channel.title: Outings with Charges – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies
channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

image.title: Outings with Charges – North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies

item.title: (triangle) Playdate Outing: Eastgate Park
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: NC PAN shares a post from a Friend for North Carolina nannies about a gathering at Eastgate Park, Raleigh on April 18, 2024, from 10 to 11:30 am. Hosted by Select Sitters, there will be coffee, snacks, and juice. Nannies should RSVP via email or social media for adequate planning of refreshments.
item.content:encoded:
Signal Boost

The following post was sent to us by a Friend of NC PAN to share with all the nannies of North Carolina. Your North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies does not know any more about this content than what we are posting here, nor are we connected with the activities mentioned. Contact information for the responsible party is included. Please contact them.

If you would like your event, outing, opportunity, or occasion signal boosted, please reach out! signalboost@ncpan.org

Date
April 18, 2024

Location
Eastgate Park
4200 Quail Hollow Dr
Raleigh, NC 27609

Time
10-11:30 am

Come hang out with the Select Sitters team at Eastgate Park in Raleigh on Thursday, April 18th!

Bring your charges to play, have some refreshments, provided by Select Sitters, and socialize a bit! They’ll provide coffee, snacks, and juice boxes.

Let them know if you’ll be able to make it so that they can plan appropriate refreshments. RSVP by email, Facebook, or Instagram.

item.title: Pumpkin Picking (2022)
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That's right, we are going pumpkin picking!
item.content:encoded:
Come join us again to pick pumpkins, learn about farming, and (most importantly) play in a giant dried corn pit! That’s right, we are going pumpkin picking!

Attend
Host
Share

Here are the outings that have been scheduled and sent to us, alphabetically by North Carolina region:

Triangle Region

When: Thursday, October 13, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating rescheduled due to weather to Thursday, October 20, 2022 @ 9 am – 1 pm floating

Where: Page Farms; 6100 Mt Herman Rd, Raleigh, NC 27617; +19195963227

Who: All caregivers and their children. Invitation extended especially – but not exclusively – to the members of the Triangle Nanny Tribe Facebook group.

Cost: There is a cost associated with this outing, and is to be paid directly to Paige Farm on arrival. Included in your admission fee is the free pumpkin that you pick.
â€‹
RSVP: On this Facebook event.

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s pumpkin picking during an October day! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area. And on top of that, we offer you a little something for being an organizer

All social events are volunteer hosted by nannies!

Spread the Word!

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Pumpkin Picking!

item.title: IRS Mileage Reimbursement Mid-Year Increase
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Starting July 1, 2022, the IRS Mileage reimbursement rate has increased.
item.content:encoded:
Starting July 1, 2022, the IRS Mileage reimbursement rate has increased to

62.5 cents a mile

This is an increase of 4 cents a mile and that’s big money.

Update your contracts, inform your employers, and keep going on adventures!

item.title: Seventh (Pandemic-Exception) Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Remember how much fun it was last year before the pandemic? Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t want to miss out! Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza Raleigh When: Monday April 11, 2022, 10 am – noonWhere: Honeycutt Park 1032 Clear Creek Farm Road, […]
item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year before the pandemic?

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t want to miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @ https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza

Raleigh

When: Monday April 11, 2022, 10 am – noon
Where: Honeycutt Park 1032 Clear Creek Farm Road, Raleigh, NC 27615
Contact: organizer via Facebook

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, etc, but nothing edible. Consider bringing a light snack to share with others.

Egg Contents Requested in order to ensure egg treat variety. Report the contents in the comments of this Facebook post.

Morrisville

When: Tuesday April 12, 2022, 10 am – noon
Where: Lake Crabtree Park
Contact: email organizer

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward! No craft.

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Durham and Chapel Hill

When: Wednesday April 13, 2022, 10 am – 12:30 pm (rain date Thursday April 14)
Where: Solite Park 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10:30 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Older children are welcome to come and help hide the eggs in advance of the hunt or to be guest videographers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies) via the form, below. All are welcome.

Submit a form.

In a Different Region or City?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies! And hosts get a gratis membership extension as a thank you for hosting. (Or become a member altogether!)

Spread the Word

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Eggstravaganza!

item.title: Children’s Mental Health Week 2022
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: In the United Kingdom, there is a week in February devoted to the mental health of children. We think this is fabulous! And so, we are doing our part to bring that week here to this side of the Atlantic. This year’s theme is Growing Together. Growing Together is about growing emotionally and finding ways to help […]
item.content:encoded:
In the United Kingdom, there is a week in February devoted to the mental health of children. We think this is fabulous! And so, we are doing our part to bring that week here to this side of the Atlantic.

This year’s theme is Growing Together. Growing Together is about growing emotionally and finding ways to help each other grow. Challenges and setbacks can help us to grow and adapt and trying new things can help us to move beyond our comfort zone into a new realm of possibility and potential. However, emotional growth is often a gradual process that happens over time, and sometimes we might feel a bit â€˜stuckâ€™. As caregivers/nannies, we play an important role in our charges’ mental health.

We’re participating!

Our schedule of activities follows. As always, we’d love your photographs of works in progress or works completed. Sharing with other nannies is informal education and perhaps your charge and yourself can be the mentor this time.

  • Monday (7 February): we introduce Watch one growth story and use it to start a conversation with our charge(s) about growth and the different challenges we may face. More information here.
  • Tuesday (8 February): who supports With our charge(s) we will complete this art activity to help them think about who supports them to grow.
  • Wednesday (9 February): the hard thing We will model to our charge(s) how to choose a difficult task. We will choose ours, and they must choose theirs. We then set aside an age/stage appropriate amount of time for us to each independently practice our chosen task. At the conclusion, we debrief about how we felt before, during, and after the task. We then use art materials to remind ourselves not to get distracted by dissuading feelings when we felt so much better after the practice. Resilience researcher Duckworth (2018) explains her rule in this shortÂ video.
  • Thursday (10 February): already grown With our charges(s) we will complete this art activity to support our charge(s) to look back at their past growths. Success breeds success.
  • Friday (11 February): work-week close out Watch a second growth story with our charge(s) and use it to start a conversation assessing how the activities this week have emboldened our charges to resiliently face the future. More information here.
  • Saturday (12 February): professional development Learn “How to Manage Your Child’s Emotions (and Your Own)” from the 2021 Happily Family Conference via on demand encore for Supporting Nannies. Supporting Nannies who are logged in to their account will find the link here: [membership level=”1″]https://vimeo.com/670458923[/membership]. This encore is for 24 hours only, so plan ahead and schedule time! For the general public, we offer you this link instead.
  • Sunday (13 February): movie night; 8 pm Join us for an online viewing of “Finding Nemo“, a movie about a fish who is not afraid to face challenges and grow through them and the adult who is making classic caregiver mistakes and has to learn to trust in the young one’s growth as well. Here’s the join link; all are invited.

item.title: The Recognition Playdates (NNRW 2021)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public […]
item.content:encoded:
National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public play area where moms and dads and grandmas and grandpas and aunts and uncles and completely disinterested strangers can all bask in the awe of the awesomeness of the way that nannies handle such things.

Read below for details on how your region is planning to awesome-bomb in order to gain recognition.

Triangle East (indoor)

Date and Time: Tuesday, September 21thÂ atÂ 9:30 to 11 am

Location: Little Doodles Play Cafe

Let’s celebrate National Nanny Recognition Week with a play date at Little Doodles Play Cafe on Glenwood Avenue in Raleigh organized by Nanny Tiffany Williams on Tuesday, September 21st from 9:30-11am!

Cost is $5 per child, adults and babies under 12 months are free! There is a messy art studio and discovery room that you can add on for an additional $5. You can buy pieces of art to paint for an additional cost if you want.

No outside food is allowed! They have a cafe and snack bar to buy snacks, treats and drinks.

No shoes or bare feet allowed. Everyone must wear socks. Socks are available for $2 if you forget to bring them!

Come any time and stay as long as you want!

Chick Fil A at Townridge is across the parking lot for anyone who wants to grab lunch after.

We’ve parked behind Chick Fil A and brought picnic blankets to eat on if you want to do that too!

Register and RSVP on Facebook (you may need to join the Triangle Nanny Tribe Group first), or by messaging volunteer host Tiffany.

Triangle West (outside)

Date and Time: Tuesday, September 21th at 10:30 am to 12 noon

Location: Durham Central Park’s Mt. Merrill Playground

Join local area nannies for a meet up at Durham Central Park’s popular Troll Story Time. The children will get a few books on a theme followed by a thematic craft or activity. After that, it is free play on the Mount Merrill Playground where the nannies can schmooze while the children slide and climb. Children can picnic for lunch, too.

Meet at “The Leaf”, an open air pavilion right next to the playground. https://goo.gl/maps/9wfegqAe2ZhKkXBFA

Rain location is “The Pavilion”. Masks are required for everyone.

Here is what Durham Parks and Rec says about Troll Story Time. https://durhamcentralpark.org/events/storytime/

Free parking on the side streets that flank the park. Look for Jen in the bright pink NANNY shirt.

Register and RSVP on Facebook (you may need to join the Playdates Group first), or by messaging volunteer host Jen.

Don’t see your region listed? Pick a place to play, such as a park or other play zone, and email the webmaster and we’ll send people your way. It is as simple as that.

item.title: The Recognition Playdates (NNRW 2019)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public […]
item.content:encoded:
National Nanny Recognition Week is to shine a glorious spotlight on to the fact that we nannies exist and rock at our jobs. What better way than to do that fabulous job, en masse, in public. And so we will! Join a flash mob of nannies and their charges having an outing to a public play area where moms and dads and grandmas and grandpas and aunts and uncles and completely disinterested strangers can all bask in the awe of the awesomeness of the way that nannies handle such things.

Read below for details on how your region is planning to awesome-bomb in order to gain recognition.

Triangle

Date and Time: Tuesday, September 24thÂ atÂ 10 am to 12 noon

Location: newhope Church’s indoor play area called Hopetown

Bring snack and/or lunch, and a clean pair of socks for every charge, and come play in the gigantic indoor play structure for the older folks, or the toy filled room for the younger tots. This outing is free and while held in a religious building, is free of proselytizing and any other attempts at conversion. They are just being good neighbors and sharing their megachurch megabucks playstructure bounty with everyone around.

Register and RSVP on Facebook, or by messaging volunteer host Jen.

Don’t see your region listed? Pick a place to play, such as a park or other play zone, and email the webmaster and we’ll send people your way. It is as simple as that.

item.title: Sixth Annual NC PAN Eggstravaganza
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Remember how much fun it was last year? Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out! Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @Â https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza Durham and Chapel Hill When: Thursday April 18, 2019, 9:30 am â€“ 12 pm Where: Solite Park @Â 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina […]
item.content:encoded:
Remember how much fun it was last year?

Well, this year we’re doing it again! And you won’t miss out!

Learn how to RSVP below! Learn more about our previous Eggstravaganzas @Â https://theinfamousj.github.io/ncpan/tag/eggstravaganza

Durham and Chapel Hill

When: Thursday April 18, 2019, 9:30 am â€“ 12 pm
Where: Solite Park @Â 4704 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, North Carolina 27713
Contact: Laura Pearl, social@ncpan.org

Come and play with your charges and hunt eggs! The egg hunt will begin about 10 am and will be aimed at toddlers and preschoolers. Older children are welcome to come and help hide the eggs in advance of the hunt or to be guest videographers. A do-at-your-own-pace craft will be available. Stay as long as you can and enjoy the park afterward!

Please bring 12 plastic eggs per child filled with something – stickers, small toys, candy, etc.

Open to NC PAN members, nannies who are not yet members of NC PAN, Friends of NC PAN, friends, moms, dads, etc.

RSVPs are MANDATORY (or else your little ones won’t be able to do the craft for lack of supplies) via the form, below. All are welcome.

[contact-form]

Wake County

When: Tuesday April 23, 2019, 9:30 am â€“ 12 pm DATE CHANGE DUE TO INCLEMENT WEATHER
Where: Peter Williams Park @ 1525 Lynn Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612-6819
Contact: Sammi Van Hoy, via Facebook

Join us at Peter Williams Park at 10am for an egg hunt and play date! Please bring at least 12 FILLED eggs for each child participating.

Peter Williams Park is in the Lynn Road Elementary School parking lot at the corner of Lynn Road and Lead Mine Road.

Please RSVP (on the RSVP post with # of people coming)! I’m hoping to bring some spring themed treats to share (if anyone else would like to bring things to share, please let me know)!

In a Different Region?

Volunteer as host for your region’s Eggstravaganza on either of the weeks that bookend Easter! If you build it, they will come! Contact the NC PAN webmaster via webmaster@ncpan.org to get started. We will promote your event, add it to this post, help you gather RSVPs, and help you connect with nannies in your area.

All social events are volunteer hosted by member nannies!

Spread the Word

Share this image to your favorite social media outlet, and add the details of your local region’s Eggstravaganza!

item.title: (triangle) Fun At Work Day Playdate 2019
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Date and Time: January 25th at 9:30 am to noon Location: near Southpoint mall; specific address provided to RSVPs only This is International Fun At Work Day, and what could be more fun at work than a playdate with new or old friends? Volunteer member nanny Jen is able to host at her nanny house (near Southpoint) and […]
item.content:encoded:
Date and Time: January 25th at 9:30 am to noon

Location: near Southpoint mall; specific address provided to RSVPs only

This is International Fun At Work Day, and what could be more fun at work than a playdate with new or old friends? Volunteer member nanny Jen is able to host at her nanny house (near Southpoint) and is supplying badly done facepainting skills so charges and nannies alike can have fun at work.

Learn more about this important annual holiday! https://www.daysoftheyear.com/days/fun-at-work-day/

Register and RSVP on Facebook, or by messaging volunteer host Jen.

Do you want to request or host a playdate of your very own? Email our webmaster! It is easy, peasy, lemonsqueezy.
